text: Henry Nichols Cobb (April 8, 1926 â€“ March 2, 2020) was an American architect. He was a founding partner with I.M. Pei and Eason H. Leonard of Pei Cobb Freed & Partners, an international architectural firm based in New York City. Cobb was born in Boston, Massachusetts. His best known designs were Hyatt Center, John Hancock Tower and U.S. Bank Tower. Cobb died in 2020, at age 93. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American architects Category:Businesspeople from Boston
title: Henry N. Cobb
